body_html:
Hi Skye! Hope all is well.

I'm talking about python 3.5, and TF 1.1

The code outputs the following error: AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode'
at the line: return f.read().decode("utf-8").replace("\n", "").split()

That's because the string is already decoded.

If you change the line to: return f.read().replace("\n", "").split() - all works well.
body_text:
Hi Skye! Hope all is well.
I'm talking about python 3.5, and TF 1.1
The code outputs the following error: AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode'
at the line:   return f.read().decode("utf-8").replace("\n", "").split()
That's because the string is already decoded.
If you change the line to: return f.read().replace("\n", "").split()   - all works well.
body:
Hi Skye! Hope all is well.

I'm talking about python 3.5, and TF 1.1

The code outputs the following error: AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode'
at the line:   return f.read().decode("utf-8").replace("\n", "<eos>").split()

That's because the string is already decoded.

If you change the line to: return f.read().replace("\n", "<eos>").split()   - all works well.
